title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Rust compiler exists with the error:
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>'

I tried this code:
http://is.gd/rQc7sJ
## Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:
rustc 1.0.0-nightly (be9bd7c93 2015-04-05) (built 2015-04-06)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: be9bd7c93a53fe554a359e60c5f78991fb783eed
commit-date: 2015-04-05
build-date: 2015-04-06
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.0.0-nightly

Backtrace:
$ cargo build --verbose
       Fresh libc v0.1.5
       Fresh log v0.3.1
   Compiling confrep v0.0.1 (file:///home/ben/coding/rust/confrep)
     Running `rustc src/main.rs --crate-name confrep --crate-type bin -g --out-dir /home/ben/coding/rust/confrep/target/debug --emit=dep-info,link -L dependency=/home/ben/coding/rust/confrep/target/debug -L dependency=/home/ben/coding/rust/confrep/target/debug/deps --extern getopts=/home/ben/coding/rust/confrep/target/debug/deps/libgetopts-13bfb58dc9e184de.rlib`
       Fresh getopts v0.2.9
src/main.rs:25:5: 25:43 warning: unreachable statement, #[warn(unreachable_code)] on by default
src/main.rs:25     let path = Path::new("/tmp/test-file");
                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
error: internal compiler error: trans_local_var: no datum for local/arg 111 found
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', /home/rustbuild/src/rust-buildbot/slave/nightly-dist-rustc-linux/build/src/libsyntax/diagnostic.rs:190

Caused by:
